cards.name: Erosion
cards.text:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, destroy that land unless that player pays {1} or 1 life.
cards.originalText: During his or her upkeep, target land's controller pays {1} or 1 life, or target land is destroyed. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life.

cards.name: Feedback
cards.text:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, Feedback deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: Feedback deals 1 damage to controller of target enchantment during that player's upkeep.

cards.name: Flight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains flying.

cards.name: Flood
cards.text: {U}{U}: Tap target creature without flying.
cards.flavor:
"A dash of cool water does wonders to clear a cluttered battlefield."
—Vibekke Ragnild, Witches and War
cards.originalText: {U}{U}: Tap target creature without flying.

cards.name: Gaseous Form
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
". . . [A]nd gives to airy nothing
A local habitation and a name."
—William Shakespeare, A Midsummer-Night's Dream

rulings.text: The enchanted creature can still attack and block.

cards.originalText: Target creature neither deals nor receives damage during combat.

cards.name: Ghost Ship
cards.text:
Flying
{U}{U}{U}: Regenerate Ghost Ship.
cards.flavor:
"That phantom prow split the storm as lightning cast its long shadow on the battlefield below."
—Mireille Gaetane, The Valeriad
cards.originalText:
Flying
{U}{U}{U}: Regenerate

cards.name: Giant Tortoise
cards.text: Giant Tortoise gets +0/+3 as long as it's untapped.
cards.originalText: Giant Tortoise gets +0/+3 while untapped.

cards.name: Hurkyl's Recall
cards.text: Return all artifacts target player owns to their hand.
cards.flavor: This spell, like many attributed to Drafna, was actually the work of his wife and former student, Hurkyl.

rulings.text: Retrieves all artifacts owned by the target player regardless of who controls them. Ignores artifacts owned by other players even if target player has control of them.
It only returns artifacts which are on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: All artifacts in play owned by target player are returned to that player's hand.

cards.name: Island Fish Jasconius
cards.text:
Island Fish Jasconius doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {U}{U}{U}. If you do, untap Island Fish Jasconius.
Island Fish Jasconius can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Island Fish Jasconius.

rulings.text: Reworded so that it triggers only once at beginning of upkeep, instead of being an activated ability usable any time during your upkeep. You can no longer make infinite combos with this ability.

cards.originalText:
Does not untap during your untap phase.
Cannot attack if defending player controls no islands. If at any time you control no islands, bury Island Fish Jasconius.
{U}{U}{U}: Untap Island Fish. Use this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Jump
cards.text: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

rulings.text: To work as an evasion ability, an attacking creature must already have flying when the declare blockers step begins. Once a creature has become blocked, giving it flying won't change that.

cards.originalText: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Leviathan
cards.text:
Trample
Leviathan enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice two Islands. If you do, untap Leviathan.
Leviathan can't attack unless you sacrifice two Islands. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)

rulings.text: You don't have to pay the untap cost if it is untapped outside the upkeep phase or is untapped by an effect.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Comes into play tapped and does not untap during your untap phase.
During your upkeep, you may sacrifice two islands to untap Leviathan.
Leviathan cannot attack unless you sacrifice two islands during your attack.

cards.name: Lifetap
cards.text: Whenever a Forest an opponent controls becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: Gives one life for each and every Forest tapped.
In multi-player games it affects all opponents.

cards.originalText: Gain 1 life each time a forest controlled by target opponent becomes tapped.

cards.name: Lord of Atlantis
cards.text: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.
cards.originalText: All Merfolk gain islandwalk and get +1/+1.

cards.name: Magical Hack
cards.text: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.
You can't change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as "Island Fish Jasconius".

Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.
It can be used to change a land's type from one basic land type to another. For example, Forest can be changed to Island so it produces blue mana. It doesn't change the name of any permanent.

cards.originalText: Change the text of target spell or target permanent by replacing all occurrences of one basic land type with another. For example, you may change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk."

cards.name: Mahamoti Djinn
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Mana Short
cards.text: Tap all lands target player controls and that player loses all unspent mana.

rulings.text: Since this is an instant, your opponent may use instants in response to the casting of this spell. Note that such spells and abilities will be resolved before the mana pool is emptied by the Mana Short. This makes it useless as a countermeasure for spells. To use it effectively, you need to use it during Upkeep and even then it will not prevent the use of instant spells and abilities.
If you play Mana Short in response to a spell, it will have no effect on that spell since the mana has already been paid.
It even taps lands that do not produce mana.

cards.originalText: Mana Short empties target player's mana pool and taps that player's lands.

cards.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
cards.flavor: Most human scholars believe that Merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from Merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

cards.name: Mind Bomb
cards.text: Each player may discard up to three cards. Mind Bomb deals damage to each player equal to 3 minus the number of cards they discarded this way.
cards.originalText: Mind Bomb deals 3 damage to each player. All players may discard up to three cards of their choice from their hands. Each card a player discards in this manner prevents 1 damage to that player from Mind Bomb.

cards.name: Phantasmal Forces
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Phantasmal Forces unless you pay {U}.
cards.flavor: These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.
cards.originalText:
Flying
During your upkeep, pay {U} or destroy Phantasmal Forces.

cards.name: Phantasmal Terrain
cards.text:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.

rulings.text: Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

cards.originalText: Target land becomes any basic land type of your choice.

cards.name: Phantom Monster
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"While, like a ghastly rapid river,
Through the pale door,
A hideous throng rush out forever,
And laugh—but smile no more."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Pirate Ship
cards.text:
Pirate Ship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{T}: Pirate Ship deals 1 damage to any target.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Pirate Ship.
cards.originalText:
Cannot attack if defending player controls no islands. If at any time you control no islands, bury Pirate Ship.
{T}: Pirate Ship deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Power Leak
cards.text:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, that player may pay any amount of mana. Power Leak deals 2 damage to that player. Prevent X of that damage, where X is the amount of mana that player paid this way.
cards.originalText: During the upkeep of target enchantment's controller, Power Leak deals 2 damage to him or her. That player may pay {1} for each damage he or she wishes to prevent from Power Leak.

cards.name: Power Sink
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If that player doesn't, they tap all lands with mana abilities they control and lose all unspent mana.

rulings.text: Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.

When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not "tapped for mana". If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.

Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tapped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

cards.originalText: Counter a target spell if its caster does not pay {X}. Target spell's caster must draw and pay all available mana from lands and mana pool until {X} is paid; he or she may also pay mana from other sources if desired.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Occasionally a member of the Institute of Arcane Study acquires a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Psionic Entity
cards.text: {T}: Psionic Entity deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to itself.
cards.flavor: Creatures of the Æther are notorious for neglecting their own well-being.

rulings.text: The artist is actually Justin Hampton.

cards.originalText: {T}: Psionic Entity deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to itself.

cards.name: Psychic Venom
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

rulings.text: Whenever the land is tapped for any reason, the ability triggers.

cards.originalText: Whenever target land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

cards.name: Relic Bind
cards.text:
Enchant artifact an opponent controls
Whenever enchanted artifact becomes tapped, choose one —
• Relic Bind deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
• Target player gains 1 life.
cards.originalText: When target artifact opponent controls becomes tapped, you may give 1 life or have Relic Bind deal 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Sea Serpent
cards.text:
Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Sea Serpent.
cards.flavor: Legend has it that Serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?
cards.originalText: Cannot attack if defending player controls no islands. If at any time you control no islands, bury Sea Serpent.

cards.name: Segovian Leviathan
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: "Leviathan, too! Can you catch him with a fish-hook or run a line round his tongue?" —Job 40:25
cards.originalText: Islandwalk

cards.name: Sindbad
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card and reveal it. If it isn't a land card, discard it.

rulings.text: If the draw is replaced by another effect, none of the rest of Sindbad's ability applies, even if the draw is replaced by another draw (such as with Enduring Renewal).
To avoid confusion, reveal the card you draw before putting it with the rest of the cards in your hand.

cards.originalText: {T}: Draw a card. If it is not a land, discard it.

cards.name: Siren's Call
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during an opponent's turn, before attackers are declared.
Creatures the active player controls attack this turn if able.
At the beginning of the next end step, destroy all non-Wall creatures that player controls that didn't attack this turn. Ignore this effect for each creature the player didn't control continuously since the beginning of the turn.

rulings.text: It will require creatures with Haste to attack since they are able, but it won't destroy them if they don't for some reason.
The creature is destroyed if it does not attack because it simply can't do so legally.
This will destroy creatures that weren't able to attack because they had been previously tapped.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can only be cast before the beginning of the Declare Attackers Step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.originalText: All of target opponent's creatures that can attack must do so. At end of turn, destroy any non-wall creatures that did not attack. Play only during opponent's turn, before opponent's attack. Siren's Call does not affect creatures brought under opponent's control this turn.

cards.name: Sleight of Mind
cards.text: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (For example, you may change "target black spell" to "target blue spell." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: You can't Sleight proper nouns (i.e. card names). This means that you can't affect a "Black Vise".
Can target a card with no color words on it.
Can't change a color word to the same color word. It must be a different word.
Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.

Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.

cards.originalText: Change the text of target spell or target permanent by replacing all occurrences of one color word with another. For example, you may change "Counters black spells" to "Counters blue spells." Sleight of Mind cannot change mana symbols.

cards.name: Spell Blast
cards.text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)

rulings.text: Alternative costs, additional costs, cost increases, and cost reductions don't affect a spell's converted mana cost.

If the target spell has {X} in its mana cost, include the value chosen for that X when determining the value of the {X} in Spell Blast's mana cost. For example, if you wish to counter Volcanic Geyser (a spell with mana cost {X}{R}{R}) whose X is 7, you'll need to choose 9 for Spell Blast's X and pay {9}{U}.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell. X is the casting cost of the target spell.

cards.name: Stasis
cards.text:
Players skip their untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Stasis unless you pay {U}.

rulings.text: Since there is no untap step, Phasing in/out won't happen.
Does not prevent cards from being untapped outside the untap step.

cards.originalText: Players do not get an untap phase. During your upkeep, pay {U} or destroy Stasis.

cards.name: Steal Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
You control enchanted artifact.

rulings.text: Can be used on artifact creatures.

cards.originalText: Gain control of target artifact.

cards.name: Sunken City
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Sunken City unless you pay {U}{U}.
Blue creatures get +1/+1.
cards.originalText: All blue creatures get +1/+1. During your upkeep, pay {U}{U} or destroy Sunken City.

cards.name: Thoughtlace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes blue. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)
cards.originalText: Change the color of target spell or target permanent to blue. Costs to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target remain unchanged.

cards.name: Time Elemental
cards.text:
When Time Elemental attacks or blocks, at end of combat, sacrifice it and it deals 5 damage to you.
{2}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent that isn't enchanted to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: You both sacrifice it and deal the 5 damage at end of combat.
A "permanent that isn't enchanted" is a permanent with no Auras on it.
If Time Elemental attacks or blocks, but you no longer control it at end of combat, you can't sacrifice it. However, it will still deal 5 damage to you.

cards.originalText: {2}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to owner's hand. You cannot use this ability on permanents with enchantment cards played on them. If Time Elemental blocks or attacks, destroy it at end of combat. In this case, Time Elemental deals 5 damage to its controller.

cards.name: Twiddle
cards.text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

rulings.text: This is not a toggle effect. If you use Twiddle to tap a card and before it takes effect your opponent taps it, Twiddle will not automatically untap the card.
The decision whether or not to tap or untap is made on resolution. This is not a modal spell.

cards.originalText: Tap or untap target land, artifact, or creature.

cards.name: Unstable Mutation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

rulings.text: The -1/-1 counters stay even if the Aura is removed, and the +3/+3 goes away when the Aura does.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3. During each of its controller's upkeeps, put a -1/-1 counter on the creature. These counters remain even if Unstable Mutation is removed.

cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText: Return target creature to owner's hand.

cards.name: Volcanic Eruption
cards.text: Destroy X target Mountains. Volcanic Eruption deals damage to each creature and each player equal to the number of Mountains put into a graveyard this way.

rulings.text: Can be used with X equal to zero. This is useful if no Mountains are on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Destroy X target mountains. Volcanic Eruption deals 1 damage to each creature and player for each mountain put into the graveyard in this way.

cards.name: Wall of Air
cards.text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: "This 'standing windstorm' can hold us off indefinitely? Ridiculous!" Saying nothing, she put a pinch of salt on the table. With a bang she clapped her hands, and the salt disappeared, blown away.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Wall of Water
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{U}: Wall of Water gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A deafening roar arose as the fury of an enormous vertical river supplanted our serenity. Eddies turned into whirling geysers, leveling everything in their path.
cards.originalText: {U}: +1/+0 until end of turn

cards.name: Water Elemental
cards.flavor: Unpredictable as the sea itself, Water Elementals shift without warning from tranquility to tempest. Capricious and fickle, they flow restlessly from one shape to another, expressing their moods with their physical forms.

cards.name: Zephyr Falcon
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor: Although greatly prized among falconers, the Zephyr Falcon is capricious and not easily tamed.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking does not cause Zephyr Falcon to tap.

cards.name: Aspect of Wolf
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+Y, where X is half the number of Forests you control, rounded down, and Y is half the number of Forests you control, rounded up.

rulings.text: The effect is continuously updated based on the number of Forests you control at any given time.

cards.originalText: Increase target creature's power and toughness by half the number of forests you control, rounding down for power and up for toughness.

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Carnivorous Plant
cards.text: Defender
cards.flavor:
"It had a mouth like that of a great beast, and gnashed its teeth as it strained to reach us. I am thankful it possessed no means of locomotion."
—Vervamon the Elder

cards.name: Channel
cards.text: Until end of turn, any time you could activate a mana ability, you may pay 1 life. If you do, add {C}.

rulings.text: Once your life total is 0, you can't pay any more life, even if you've somehow not lost the game yet.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, you may add colorless mana to your mana pool at a cost of 1 life per one mana. Play these additions as interrupts. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life.

cards.name: Cockatrice
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Cockatrice blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

rulings.text: The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

cards.originalText:
Flying
At the end of combat, destroy all non-wall creatures blocking or blocked by Cockatrice.

cards.name: Craw Wurm
cards.flavor: The most terrifying thing about the Craw Wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

cards.name: Crumble
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: The spirits of Argoth grant new life to those who repent the folly of enslaving their labors to devices.

rulings.text: If the target artifact becomes illegal before resolution, the player does not gain any life.

cards.originalText: Bury target artifact. Artifact's controller gains life equal to the artifact's casting cost.

cards.name: Desert Twister
cards.text: Destroy target permanent.
cards.originalText: Destroy target permanent.

cards.name: Durkwood Boars
cards.flavor:
"And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine: and the herd ran violently . . . ."
—Mark 5:13

cards.name: Elven Riders
cards.text: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Sometimes it is better to be swift of foot than strong of swordarm."
—Elven proverb

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have Flying, so they can't block this.

cards.originalText: Cannot be blocked except by walls and by creatures with flying.

cards.name: Elvish Archers
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!"
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.originalText: No creatures deal damage in combat this turn.

cards.name: Force of Nature
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.
cards.originalText:
Trample
During your upkeep, pay {G}{G}{G}{G} or Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you.

cards.name: Fungusaur
cards.text: Whenever Fungusaur is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: Rather than sheltering her young, the female Fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.

rulings.text: If more than one creature damages it at one time, it only gets one counter.

cards.originalText: At the end of any turn in which Fungusaur receives damage but does not leave play, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Gaea's Liege
cards.text:
As long as Gaea's Liege isn't attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control. As long as Gaea's Liege is attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests defending player controls.
{T}: Target land becomes a Forest until Gaea's Liege leaves the battlefield.

rulings.text: When being declared as an attacker, use the "not attacking" power and toughness. It only changes after declaration is complete.
The activated ability doesn't affect whether the land is basic or not. It overwrites any other land types. Being a Forest gives the affected land the ability "{T}: Add {G}."
Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

cards.originalText:
Gaea's Liege has power and toughness each equal to the number of forests you control; when Gaea's Liege attacks, these are instead equal to the number of forests defending player controls.
{T}: Target land becomes a basic forest until Gaea's Liege leaves play.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText: Can block creatures with flying.

cards.name: Grizzly Bears
cards.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominia's Grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

cards.name: Hurricane
cards.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.originalText: Hurricane deals X damage to each player and each creature with flying.

cards.name: Instill Energy
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can attack as though it had haste.
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.

rulings.text: If attached to an opponent's creature, you can untap their creature during your turn.
Instill Energy's untap ability will not untap the creature until it resolves. This means other spells and abilities can be used before it actually becomes untapped.

Any Auras (or other effects) which are on the creature that would cause it to not be untapped (or have a cost to be untapped) during untap step do not in any way hinder or imply a cost to use this card's ability to untap once during the turn.

cards.originalText:
Target creature can attack the turn it comes into play on your side.
{0}: During your turn, untap target creature Instill Energy enchants. Use this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Ironroot Treefolk
cards.flavor: The mating habits of Treefolk, particularly the stalwart Ironroot Treefolk, are truly absurd. Molasses comes to mind. It's amazing the species can survive at all given such protracted periods of mate selection, conjugation, and gestation.

cards.name: Killer Bees
cards.text:
Flying
{G}: Killer Bees gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The communal mind produces a savage strategy, yet no one could predict that this vicious crossbreed would unravel the secret of steel.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{G}: +1/+1 until end of turn

cards.name: Land Leeches
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor:
"The standard cure for leeches requires the application of burning embers. Alternative methods must be devised should an ember of sufficient size prove more harmful than the leech."
—Vervamon the Elder
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Ley Druid
cards.text: {T}: Untap target land.
cards.flavor: After years of training, the Druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

rulings.text: The land is untapped as a normal ability that goes on the stack. It is not a mana ability, so it can't be used at times that only mana abilities can be used.

cards.originalText: {T}: Untap target land. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Lifeforce
cards.text: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell.
cards.originalText: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Lifelace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes green. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)
cards.originalText: Change the color of target spell or target permanent to green. Costs to cast, tap, maintain or use a special ability of target remain unchanged.

cards.name: Living Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
Whenever you're dealt damage, put that many vitality counters on Living Artifact.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a vitality counter from Living Artifact. If you do, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: You can cast it targeting your opponent's artifacts. The controller of the Aura (not the controller of the artifact) controls the Living Artifact ability.
Does not trigger on loss of life, just on damage.

cards.originalText:
Put a vitality counter on Living Artifact for each damage dealt to you.
{0}: During your upkeep, remove a vitality counter to gain 1 life. Remove only one vitality counter during each of your upkeeps.

cards.name: Living Lands
cards.text: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: All forests become 1/1 creatures. The forests still count as lands but cannot be tapped for mana the turn they come into play.

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor: Hardened by their life in the haunted Llanowar Forest, these fierce beings are outcasts among elvenkind.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

rulings.text: Lure doesn't give any creatures the ability to block the target creature. It just forces those creatures that are already able to block the creature to do so.

As blockers are declared, any creature that's tapped or affected by a spell or ability that says it can't block doesn't block. If there's a cost associated with having the creature block, no player is forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't block if that cost isn't paid.

cards.originalText: All creatures able to block target creature must do so. Lure does not prevent a creature from blocking more than one creature if blocker has that ability. If blocker is forced to block more creatures than it is allowed to, defender chooses which of these creatures to block, but must block as many creatures as allowed.

cards.name: Marsh Viper
cards.text: Whenever Marsh Viper deals damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
cards.flavor: "All we had left were their black and bloated bodies." —Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier
cards.originalText: If Marsh Viper damages a player, he or she gets two poison counters. If a player has ten or more poison counters, he or she loses the game.

cards.name: Nafs Asp
cards.text: Whenever Nafs Asp deals damage to a player, that player loses 1 life at the beginning of their next draw step unless they pay {1} before that draw step.

rulings.text: If its damage gets redirected to its controller, it will still trigger the ability.
The player can pay the {1} mana at any time after damage is done before the draw step of that player's turn. People commonly pay during upkeep.
If it damages a player twice, they get to pay or take damage twice during their next draw step.
The ability does not cause itself to trigger again. It cause loss of life, and not damage.

cards.originalText: If Nafs Asp damages a player, it also deals 1 damage to that player during his or her next draw phase. Before then, the player may pay {1} to prevent this damage.

cards.name: Pradesh Gypsies
cards.text: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Radjan Spirit
cards.text: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

rulings.text: Can be used on a creature without Flying with no effect.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Rebirth
cards.text:
Remove Rebirth from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
Each player may ante the top card of their library. If a player does, that player's life total becomes 20.
cards.originalText: Each player may be healed to 20 life. Any player choosing to be healed antes an additional card from the top of his or her library. Remove Rebirth from your deck before playing if not playing for ante.

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.originalText: {G}: Regenerate target creature Regeneration enchants.

cards.name: Sandstorm
cards.text: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.
cards.flavor: Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.
cards.originalText: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to all attacking creatures.

cards.name: Scryb Sprites
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the Faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Shanodin Dryads
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the Dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.
cards.originalText: Forestwalk

cards.name: Stream of Life
cards.text: Target player gains X life.
cards.originalText: Target player gains X life.

cards.name: Sylvan Library
cards.text: At the beginning of your draw step, you may draw two additional cards. If you do, choose two cards in your hand drawn this turn. For each of those cards, pay 4 life or put the card on top of your library.

rulings.text: You always perform your normal draw before this ability. The normal draw occurs before anything can be placed on the stack during a player's draw step.

If you control other triggered abilities that allow you to draw cards during your draw step, you can choose to order Sylvan Library's ability before or after those abilities. Triggered abilities controlled by other players will resolve before triggered abilities you control.

Any cards drawn prior to Sylvan Library's ability resolving, including in your upkeep or in response to Sylvan Library's triggered ability, can be chosen to be put back using this effect. Sylvan Library's controller is responsible for keeping these cards distinguishable in hand, such as by keeping them separate from cards that began the turn in hand.
If you control more than one Sylvan Library, the triggered ability of each will resolve in sequence. You don't get to draw all the cards at once and then put them all back at once.
You can put back zero, one, or two cards.

If you choose to draw two cards, then replace one or more of those draws with some other effect, the rest of Sylvan Library's ability still happens. If you've actually drawn only one card that turn, you must choose that card and either pay 4 life or put it on top of your library. If you haven't actually drawn any cards that turn, the rest of the ability has no effect.
It's not possible to take any actions between drawing the cards and choosing two cards. You can't cast the cards you drew to avoid having two cards to choose.

cards.originalText: You may draw two extra cards during your draw phase. If you do so, put two of the cards drawn this turn back on top of your library (in any order) or pay 4 life per card not replaced. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life.

cards.name: Thicket Basilisk
cards.text: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the Basilisk's power.

rulings.text: Protection from Green does not stop the Basilisk's ability because the ability is not targeted.

The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

cards.originalText: At the end of combat, destroy all non-wall creatures blocking or blocked by Basilisk.

cards.name: Timber Wolves
cards.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Though many think of Wolves as solitary predators, they are actually extremely social animals. During a hunt they often call to each other, which can be quite unsettling for their prey.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: Banding

cards.name: Titania's Song
cards.text: Each noncreature artifact loses all abilities and becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. If Titania's Song leaves the battlefield, this effect continues until end of turn.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: All non-creature artifacts lose all their usual abilities and become artifact creatures with toughness and power each equal to their casting costs. If Titania's Song leaves play, artifacts return to normal just before the untap phase of the next turn.

cards.name: Tranquility
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.
cards.originalText: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.name: Tsunami
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.
cards.originalText: Destroy all islands.

cards.name: Untamed Wilds
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Can fetch a snow land.

cards.originalText: Search your library for any one basic land and put it directly into play. This does not count towards your one land per turn limit. Reshuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Venom
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy the other creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor:
"I told him it was just a flesh wound, but the next time I looked at him, poor Tadhg was dead and gone."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

rulings.text: If this Aura is moved onto a creature after blockers are declared, creatures blocking the newly-enchanted creature are not affected. This is because the ability triggers at the time blocking occurs.

cards.originalText: At the end of combat, destroy all non-wall creatures blocking or blocked by target creature.

cards.name: Verduran Enchantress
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: Some say magic was first practiced by women, who have always felt strong ties to the land.
cards.originalText: {0}: Draw a card when you successfully cast an enchantment. Use this effect only once for each enchantment cast.

cards.name: Wall of Brambles
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{G}: Regenerate Wall of Brambles.
cards.flavor:
"What else, when chaos
draws all forces inward
to shape a single leaf."
—Conrad Aiken
cards.originalText: {G}: Regenerate

cards.name: Wall of Ice
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor:
"And through the drifts the snowy cliffs
Did send a dismal sheen:
Nor shapes of men nor beasts we ken—
The ice was all between."
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

cards.name: Wall of Wood
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor: Everybody knows that to ward off trouble, you knock on wood. But usually it's better to make a wall out of the wood and let trouble do the knocking.

cards.name: Wanderlust
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Wanderlust deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: Wanderlust deals 1 damage to target creature's controller during that player's upkeep.
